text: Yama is the god of death in Hinduism and Buddhism. In Japan he is called "Enma" and "Great King Enma". His name is related to Ymir, the ancestor of the j√∂tnar in Norse mythology, whose body became the universe. The dwarf planet Pluto was named after the god of death in Roman mythology, similar to Yama. This means Pluto is called "Yama" in the Hindi language. Category:Hindu gods and goddesses Category:Buddhist gods and goddesses Category:Gods and goddesses of the underworld
title: Yama
